summary: This is an email exchange between Assistant United States Attorneys regarding the upcoming trial of Ghislaine Maxwell. It contains a motivational message about the importance of the case and logistical details for the trial's opening day, including courtroom assignments and timing.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The accused in the case 'United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell'. The email states she sexually exploited underage girls and caused harm to vulnerable kids.

events.title: Opening of Ghislaine Maxwell Trial
events.description: The opening day of the trial for United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, including peremptory challenges, preliminary instructions, and opening statements.

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, One St. Andrew's Plaza
keyFacts: The document is a pre-trial email from an Assistant U.S. Attorney expressing confidence in the case against Ghislaine Maxwell.
It asserts that Ghislaine Maxwell sexually exploited underage girls and caused unspeakable harm to vulnerable kids.
It references the prosecution's intent to prove sex crimes dating back to 1994.
It provides specific logistical details for the trial's opening day on November 29, 2021, including multiple overflow courtrooms.
The email frames the trial as a pursuit of justice where 'brave women will take the witness stand'.
